caption: Table 1: Pearson coefficients between metrics and coverage difference expectation under concept shift
description: This table presents the Pearson correlation coefficients between different metrics (NTW, total variation, KL divergence, expectation difference, standard, normalized and truncated Wasserstein distance) and the coverage difference expectation.  The Pearson correlation coefficient measures the linear correlation between the metric and the coverage difference. A higher coefficient indicates that the metric is better at predicting the coverage difference. The table shows results for multiple datasets and models (MLP and PDE).

caption: Table 2: Related works and mRCP
description: This table compares the proposed mRCP method with existing conformal prediction methods. It contrasts the number of test domains considered, the type of domain shift (exchangeability, covariate shift, joint distribution shift), and the specific approaches used to handle these shifts.  The table provides context for the novel contributions of mRCP by highlighting the limitations of prior work in handling multiple test domains and joint distribution shifts.

caption: Table 3: β values for mRCP and V-REx in experiment setups
description: This table shows the hyperparameter β values used for the Multi-domain Robust Conformal Prediction (mRCP) and the V-REx algorithms in different experiment setups across seven datasets. The values of β are varied for each dataset and model (MLP and PDE) to explore the trade-off between prediction residual and coverage difference expectation in Pareto curve.
